title: Two Blocks and One Light String

content.question: Blocks A and B, of masses <math alttext="m" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="2 m" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>m</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, respectively, are connected by a light string and pulled across a surface of negligible friction with a constant force <math alttext="F sub 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, as shown above. The acceleration of the blocks is <math alttext="a" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. The force of the string pulling block B forward has magnitude <math alttext="F sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following claims correctly describes the relationship between the magnitude of the forces acting on the blocks?

choices.label: <math alttext="F sub 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> is equal to <math alttext="F sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>.

<math alttext="F sub 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> is greater than <math alttext="F sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>.

<math alttext="F sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> is equal to <math alttext="3 m a" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>m</mi><mi>a</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.

<math alttext="F sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> is greater than <math alttext="3 m a" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>m</mi><mi>a</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: <math alttext="F sub 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> is greater than <math alttext="F sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>.

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
